title: ESG Data Operations
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for creation and full ownership of KKR’s ESG Regulatory Data Platform
Work closely with Compliance to ensure all data points needed for ESG Regulatory Reporting are identified and mapped to a source system
Collaborate with Engineering to build ETL processes to funnel data into KKR Database environment.
Create requirements for, and implement, curated tables in KKR’s Database environment to enable and automate ESG Regulatory reporting.
Engage with Finance to ensure financial data points are provided in a usable and scalable fashion
Implement and own best in class data governance practices; ensuring that data is well defined & transparently documented (what data exists, where does it exist, and how is it being used) 
Develop and own critical business processes that maintain controls to ensure high quality data; seeking to systematically control & measure data quality (introducing data validations & exception reporting) 
Ensures standards are developed for scalable processes throughout the lifecycle of a deal with well-defined information properly captured throughout that cycle 
Point of contact for data-related questions and updates from various internal and external groups, delivering ad-hoc analytics to answer key business questions in a timely manner
PRIMARY QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
5+ years of relevant experience in European Regulatory Reporting and/or Compliance
Detailed knowledge and understanding of SFDR reporting requirements and experience in the recent reporting cycle. The candidate should also have a strong understanding of the financial and ESG data points required and their application across all asset classes.
Strong technical skills in data querying & manipulation; must have advanced (expert) Excel skills and at least mid-level SQL querying abilities (selects, joins, etc.) – comfort with large sets of poorly structured data. Working knowledge of Python a plus
Advanced analytical & data visualization capabilities (with proficiency in using Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or similar tools to support those analyses & data visualizations) required
Working knowledge of Financial Data Points and Reporting, including Fund Accounting Concepts, being able to "speak Finance’s language” as needed to describe requirements.
Capable of, and interested in, developing a deep understanding of the business to play a key strategic role
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; detail oriented with strong analytical and quantitative skills, coupled with qualitative insight
Collaborative and active contributor, with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” attitude in a fast-paced environment
Maturity and sound judgment, exhibiting an ability to thrive in cross-functional and cross-business unit settings
Proven ability to manage demands of multiple projects in a fast-paced work environment, including ability to prioritize time efficiently and handle competing priorities while remaining connected to the details
High level of intellectual curiosity, accountability, and drive; self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously
Aptitude for critical and creative thinking across the quantitative and qualitative spectrum
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems, or other related fields; and/or relevant industry experience in Compliance Space
Experience with Power Apps/Power Automate a plus
KKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
